qas.question: Are minority leadership roles specified closely?
What congressman largely specified the job description of minority leader?
What despcription was assigned to minority leader in part?

answers.text: He is spokesman for his party and enunciates its policies.

qas.question: What defines a large part of minority leader role?
How defined are the roles of majority leader?
What is used to define what the function of majority leader is?
What kind of tactics were usually used by the majority leader from 1931-1939?

plausible_answers.text: spokesman for his party and enunciates its policies

qas.question: What are some of the duties of a majority leader?
What is majority leader supposed to defend for the majority?

context: The roles and responsibilities of the minority leader <a0_0>are <b4_0>not well<b4_0/>-defined<a0_0/>. To a large extent, the functions of the minority leader are defined by <a3_0><b5_0>tradition and custom<b5_0/><a3_0/>. A minority leader from 1931 to 1939, <a1_0>Representative Bertrand Snell<a1_0/>, R-N.Y., provided this "job description": "<a2_0>He is <b7_0>spokesman for his party and enunciates its policies<b7_0/>.<a2_0/> He is required to be alert and vigilant in defense of the minority's <b8_0>rights<b8_0/>. It is his function and duty to criticize constructively the policies and programs of the majority, and to this end employ <b6_0>parliamentary tactics<b6_0/> and give close attention to all proposed legislation."
